arts.ttl: Man City vs Tottenham: Premier League Preview, Prediction & Lineups
arts.sum: Tottenham have a tough assignment on the second weekend of the new Premier League season.

arts.ttl: Top 10 transfer hijackings: Sir Alex Ferguson's phone call which denied rivals, Man City's deadline day shock, and the club who keep getting gazumped - as Arsenal steal in to deny Tottenham Eberechi Eze
arts.sum: JOE BERNSTEIN: Daily Mail Sport's JOE BERNSTEIN looks back on 10 of the most memorable transfer hijackings from across the decades.

arts.ttl: Reijnders, Cherki out to break Man City PL scoring records in Spurs clash
arts.sum: The Netherlands international is expected to retain his starting spot in Man Cityâs midfield this weekend and he will attempt to become the first player in the clubâs history to both score and assist in his first two appearances in the Premier League. Whether Cherki starts or comes on as a substitute against Spurs, he or teammate Reijnders could become the first Man City player since Emmanuel Adebayor back in August 2009 to score in their first two Premier League games for the club.

arts.ttl: Pre-Match Analysis: Tottenham take on rejuvenated Manchester City at the Etihad
arts.sum: The 27-year-old, who Tottenham were on the verge of signing after weeks of negotiations, would have fit perfectly into Thomas Frank’s squad- not just for his renowned ability, but also given the major blow Spurs suffered with the long-term injury picked up by Eze's compatriot James Maddison in pre-season. The 30-year-old started on the bench last week, likely due to his lack of game time prior to joining Spurs.

arts.ttl: Shearer and Cole in his sights: Haaland can break and equal PL scoring records vs. Spurs
arts.sum: Erling Haaland will be looking to add a couple more goalscoring records to his ever-growing collection in the Premier League when Manchester City welcome Tottenham Hotspur to the Etihad Stadium on Saturday lunchtime.

arts.ttl: Guardiola: Rodri, Foden back for Tottenham game
arts.sum: Manchester City are set to welcome back Rodri and Phil Foden for ther visit of Tottenham but a late decision over whether to restore Éderson in goal.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola gives fitness updates on Rodri and Phil Foden ahead of Tottenham test
arts.sum: Man City welcome back their linchpin midfielder to the Premier League for the first time since injuring his ACL at the start of last season

arts.ttl: Rodri, Foden and Ederson available vs. Spurs, Gvardiol and Savinho missing
arts.sum: Guardiola confirmed Ederson's return, while Savinho and Gvardiol remain absent. Rodri and Foden are back in contention, with Guardiola hailing Rodri as “the best player in the world.”

arts.ttl: Man City Predicted Lineup vs. Tottenham: Rodri, Foden Not Ready to Start
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola’s Cityzens won handsomely on Gameweek One in the absence of key players.

arts.ttl: Tottenham Predicted Lineup vs. Man City: Frank Returns to Super Cup Playbook
arts.sum: Tottenham have remarkably not added to their squad since the start of the new season.
